author: FRONTLINE PBS | Official
description:
Less than four months before an Army reservist would carry out the deadliest shooting in Maine's history came one in a series of warnings. Watch a video drawn from "Breakdown in Maine," a new documentary from FRONTLINE, Maine Public and the Portland Press Herald. 

This journalism is made possible by viewers like you. Support your local PBS station here: https://www.pbs.org/donate​

For the full story, watch “Breakdown in Maine” starting Dec. 10, 2024: https://to.pbs.org/3ZzzHES

"Breakdown in Maine" is a FRONTLINE Production with Storyboard Studios LLC. The director is Bronwyn Berry. The producer is James Blue. The writers are Bronwyn Berry & James Blue. The journalists from the Portland Press Herald are Julia Arenstam and John Terhune; and from Maine Public, Steve Mistler and Susan Sharon. The CEO and Publisher of the Maine Trust for Local News/Portland Press Herald is Lisa DeSisto. The President and CEO of Maine Public is Rick Schneider. The senior editor of FRONTLINE’s Local Jour
title: Amid Warnings, Why Wasn't the Lewiston, ME Shooter Stopped? | FRONTLINE/@Pressherald/@MainePublic
